New Records: Chahal's 67 T20I wickets are now the most for India. He overtook Bumrah, who has 66 scalps.
Key Match Events: India won by 7 wickets with 17 balls remaining.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar rocked Sri Lanka with two early blows, taking 2 for 9 from two overs.
Charith Asalanka showed fight with an unbeaten 53 off 47 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Dharamsala weather was in focus as India hunted for their 11th straight T20I win against an injury-hit Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka's batting line-up could be bolstered after new squad members were added.
India and Sri Lanka were missing many of their first-choice players, making it a battle of bench strengths.
India's fielding, especially catching, needed improvement as highlighted by Rohit Sharma.
Sri Lanka added Niroshan Dickwella and Dhananjaya de Silva to the T20I squad due to injuries to Maheesh Theekshana and Kusal Mendis.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain could have played spoilsport as it did in previous matches in Dharamsala.
Since losing to New Zealand at the T20 World Cup, India have won ten T20Is on the trot. The record for the most successive T20I wins is held jointly by Afghanistan and Romania with 12 wins.
Sri Lanka have won three and lost 12 of the 16 T20Is they have played in India. Their win-loss ratio of 0.250 is their joint-worst in any country.
